result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tahid M Ratliff

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:01 PM Defendant Tahid M Ratliff in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Tahid M Ratliff. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  State has no objection to reinstating bail and setting for another pretrial conference.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates bond.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

3:55 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Tahid M Ratliff not in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Tahid M Ratliff. 

Attorney Herbers does not have an explanation for the Defendant's non appearance.
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a bench warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 3.
As to Tahid M Ratliff, Notice of Assignment of Judge, returned to sender and unable to forward.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
